Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: Viktor P
Reviews.Content: What can I say? That I probably got food poisoning? That the staff were at best incompetent at worst insulting? That the rooms were terrible? That the internet didn't work? That it is extremely expensive? It's location is great though. Let me explain very briefly as I do not want to waste any more time. I won't give too many details but epigrammatically here goes: Service unattentive, only people at the front desk made some effort. Nobody to help with luggage when we arrived with the taxi. Standard room was EXTREMELY small. Barely enough space to move and a bathroom I couldn't fit it (I am not large). It also stank and was dirty. Had to change to the j suite which was niceish but carpet very dirty. Room service never once brought the right order, food quality was poor and I think I got food poisoning from the yogurt in the morning of day two(was probably off but didn't check). As a result I spent the third day sick in bed. Person on the phone was even rude when I asked for hard boiled eggs for my stomach (refused to help) and then brought soft boiled eggs. Internet didn't work, was repeatedly told it would be fixed promptly, even given codes to use that weren't working (four times), in order to just waste our time. What else? It was noisy. Noise that we were told was coming from the shop next door (relentless drilling and banging at 8.30 in the morning until we left the room to go out!! didn't return until evening when it had stopped), noise from renovation that was going on...Never again do I want anything to do with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a superb Parisian location”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a night at the Hotel Castille this past February and here are our observations: 1. Location: The location is superbly situated on rue Cambon, about a 3 minute walk from the Rue de Rivoli and Place Vendome. 2. Decor: Clearly a great deal of effort went into the interior design of Hotel Castille. Our room was chicly decorated in cream and black whereas the lobby was elegantly appointed with rich crushed velvet sofas and jewel toned accessories. 3. Room: Our room was small but well furnished with all the usual trappings of a nice hotel such as flat screen tv, safe, heated towel rack, etc... The bathoom was equipped with "StarHotels" toiletries that smelled rather ordinary. 4. Wifi: Complimentary for multiple users per room. 5. Food: We ordered room service for breakfast and it was delivered within 20 minutes. The egg white omelets and porridge were well prepared, and there was a generous supply of fresh pastries and coffee. 6. Service: This was really the only negative aspect of our stay at Hotel Castille. The young fellow checking us in spoke very little English and seemed quite inexperienced. For example, he told us our room wasn't ready but when I asked one of his colleagues if there was an available room, she quickly found one. When he took us up to our room, he said "here's the bathroom" before abruptly leaving. Very odd.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuMatos
Reviews.Content: The best location and a great staff! I felt at home! and it's beside the Chanel store where madame Chanel lived! it's a big and beautiful store! the hotel is very good,clean,with marble bathroom,very clean,and very polited staff. just loved and would back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCandCT
Reviews.Content: We love this part of Paris and have tried a few hotels in this area. Overall, given the price, location and service, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who values location and value over grandness. We stayed in Room 511, facing the courtyard. I think it may have been classified as a junior suite, but would have been a regular room anywhere in the US with possible exception of the boutique hotels in NYC. The room was "largish", with a separate sitting area, a desk, TV and separate shower/sink and a toilet. The shower was good, the water hot and the pressure quite adequate - although I still don't get the European insistence of not enclosing the showers, allowing the water to spray across the bathroom. The bathroom was very clean, in fact, I was able to take a bath, something that I rarely do in a hotel bathroom. The bed was large, and very comfortable. The linens felt nice and the towels were large and very absorbent. The room came with 2 bathrobes - nice touch when traveling with carry-on luggage. The staff was super nice, great concierge service. Very nice bar where we had a number of late night drinks and chats with a very friendly bartender. The morning buffet was ok, it could have been better - the eggs were not great, the croissants were freshly baked but tasted like they were previously frozen. The lobby is very comfortable and very nicely furnished. It is a great place to meet up with friends or just relax after a day of sightseeing or shopping. And just in case you love to savor your time in Paris to the last possible moment and you happen to patronize the Ritz' bars which close at 2:30 am, the back door of the Ritz is directly across the street from the entrance to Castille. You can stagger out of the bar and be in bed 3 minutes later. The bottom line is - Castille is a little boutique hotel, charming and cute. It is not the Bristol or the Ritz, but in its price point it has a lot to recommend itself. And the location is superb, on Rue Cambon, next to Coco Chanel's store, right in the back of the Ritz hotel, and down the street from the best shopping in the world - Faubourg St. Honore. I truly think that any traveller, providing that his/her expectations are in line with this type of establishment, will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: FredK1412
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was very close to my office. I spent there 3 nights. The rooms are very similar to the ones in other Starhotels (e.g. the Rosa Grand in Milan). It was small but comfortable. The only "wrong" thing was that my room was on the street and the window was not closing correctly. I asked the staff to do something but I had to deal with it myself. Other than that, the service was really good, the reception staff was very efficient and kind and the common areas are very nice. The breakfast could be a little bit better for the price and a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Clumsle
Reviews.Content: Firsty, the Hotel is in what we consider to be the best high-end few blocks. Near the best of the best restaurants, competitor hotels, and conveniently within walking distance to many of Paris' tourist point. What you wouldn't walk to is a simple cab drive away.  We stayed in a double story room overlooking the idyllic Parisian street below. The living and bathroom were downstairs, with a king bedroom and ensuite upstairs. The room was faultless and was kept immaculate by the staff throughout our entire stay. Breakfast was on par with all good hotels, and the general service from the front desk was friendly and competent. When we need a mid-to-high level hotel in Paris again (and we've recommended to many friends), we would stay here in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet Attentive and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jambony
Reviews.Content: Besides the great location the Castille has old flare elegance with all the modern conviniences. We arrived early and although our rooms werent ready (as expected) the friendly straf stored our luggage. We changed clothes and were off about town. when we returned we had the pleasent surprise of being upgraded to the Coco Chanel Room ( hotel located next to Chanel offices I believe)- Lovley and quite spacious. The concierege was wonderful with the best directions and advise but it was his approach that made hom stand out above the rest so knowlegeable with a great sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Should have known better....”
Reviews.Author: mjlove
Reviews.Content: We knew it was too good to be true, boutique hotel in the centre of Paris, for £250 a night....We booked 3 nights at this hotel between Christmas and New Year 2011, and was a big mistake. Base on the photos on the website, we thought this looked a nice hotel and would be a good place to stay for our first trip to Paris. On arrival, we were allocated a room on the 2nd floor, and couldn't believe what we saw when we opened the door...a tiny shabby room in need of a complete refurb. We returned to the front desk to complain, and using the photos from their own website argued that the room wasn't up to standard. The staff said that the rooms on the web site were suites and the room we had been allocated initially was a superior room and was scheduled for redecoration in 2012. They agreed to reallocate a new room on the 6th floor, which had been recently refreshed...not sure how "recently" this had occurred, as it was rather tired, with marks on the wall and bathroom. It was also tiny...I've never stayed in such a small room. The room has TV /mini bar etc, but was so small, I could lie in the "Double"? bed and put my foot into the bathroom!...To be fair, the room was relevantly clean, but we felt mislead by the photos published on their hotel site, and we would never have booked this as a place to stay. The hotel is classed as a 4 star hotel, I think its probably more like a 2 or at a push a Uk 3. Its a lesson to us, if the hotel looks too good to be true...it probably is. We'll be back to Paris, but won't be back to a StarHotel any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “The best time”
Reviews.Author: Barbnj
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt like home almost immediately. The staff,especially the concierge, not only made our reservations, but also seemed to read our minds before we had a chance to ask for anything. Our room was spacious and very comfortable with a large bathroom. Such a surprise for us. The location on the Rue Cambon, across from Bar Hemingway in the Hotel Ritz was perfect. Actually we have stayed at the Ritz, and I much preferred the intmacy and charm of the Castille. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: pena5504
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cozy and beautiful but the staff ruin it!! I was in Paris 12 days and stayed here only 4 nights thank God. However, these four nights were the first I encountered such rude people. The check-in people and surrounding staff are ok. It's the concierge!! Rude!!!! Good luck with that part. Speak with authority, firm, and to the point or don't bother. The Internet doesn't work at all. The only good thing about the location is your next door to Chanel. The 1st ever in the world. Literally next door to Coco Chanel's apartment. The rooms are really cute, beds are comfy, linens good. However, the rooms are small. The building is old and dusty. If you have allergies stay away from this place. I literally got sick from the old drapes and carpet. However, setting negativity aside its cute, trendy, and a decent price. So I liked it but I would stay at another place of possible.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying 5 nights at this lovely hotel on our honeymoon during the first week in November. We selected the hotel based on a great location and good reviews, and the experience was wonderful. We were upgraded to a suite (from a junior suite) and the decor, in the Coco style, was beautiful. The two concierges, Mekki and Nahim, not only booked our dinners flawlessly, but they also made helpful suggestions on other things to do and see. Our package also included breakfast at the hotel which was beautifully presented. We have nothing but warm memories of the Castille and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cute find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Natasha K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. When I first arrived the reception was incredibly busy. It seemed like they didn't have enough staff to cater to all the guests that were checking in and out. However, the service was very friendly and they did what they could to accomodate. The room itself was small-ish and a bit dated but definitely comfortable. The hotel did have a gym but it only had 1 treadmill and 1 eliptical and some weights (if you're into going to the gym when you're in Paris). Breakfast was quite expensive (18 euro for continental) and not that amazing, I had some mushy fruit salad and plain yogurt which wasn't that appetizing. It is a very clean and lobby reception area is very cosy. It's not a horrible hotel by any means but it definitely not outstanding. The location is amazing, very close to the Lourve and the shopping street Capucines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: deereJanet
Reviews.Content: We have stay at Castille many times. We like the location. The rates are affordable. There are a few issues. It would be nice if they ever remember we are returning guest. The Internet has problems most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: GreatBearCaifornia
Reviews.Content: American Express Platinum Travel recommended this hotel, so we agreed to try it. It was nice, but a bit overpriced from what we have paid for other hotel rooms. However, I guess that overpriced is to be expected in Paris. The staff was friendly. The concierge was very helpful. The room was fine. The breakfast buffet was okay but not great. For some reason this hotel did not have a restaurant open for lunch. The location is very good, since you can easily walk to a large number of attractions. Overall it is fine, it is just not exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Jujush
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel sharing a duplex suite for three people - the room was very spacious compared to other rooms in Parisian hotels ! There was a large range of amenities, bath robe, slippers and a fully functioning hair dryer to make the stay more comfortable. The third person slept in a rather small bed, smaller than some single beds one could say... but this is the usual third bed concept. The concierge was kind enough to help us with various reservations, introducing us to new restaurants serving excellent food. The central location of the hotel is great when only in Paris for a few days. All the shopping and sight seeing can be done by foot when the weather allows it. One relatively important issue was the internet - it was apparently free, but not free and one had to keep asking for new user names and passwords; along with which the internet stopped working fully at some point. It would be nice to have a free and easy wifi access all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivy93
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location at the backdoor of The Ritz, 4 blocks from The Louvre, 4 blocks from The Seine on the Right Bank and otherwise couldn't be better. While a nice boutique hotel literally next door the the headquartes of CHANEL where all the staff from out of town stay it's rather over-priced but I would absolutely stay there again for the location. The buffet breakfast in the morning is quite good in the quiet atmosphere of the intimate diningroom.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location and has a very kind and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: finefoodlover4ever
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for the price and for what we paid I think we got our money's worth. The bed is super comfy, but the room was very small. I think that was our fault though as we tried to save a little by getting a standard room. But the room was pretty and they supplied extras, like robes and slippers and a mini bar. They have a small work out room which we did use one day. And the dining there is just wonderful; we knew of the hotel because we had dined at L'Assiago before on our last trip in May, great Italian food. The chef is from Italy and really makes some incredible flavors. The concierge and door people are excellent here; they confirmed our 3 Michelin restaurants we had reserved earlier for us and were always quick with directions and maps. They supplied umbrellas on the only day it rained and they were so adept at getting cabs in a timely manner, very appreciated. It was fashion week, so they were very busy, but not too busy for us. I would stay again if I got a suite, but we pack a lot of belongings, so if you don't travel as we do you won't mind the smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty surprise in the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBlueBoy
Reviews.Content: It's a real pity that the rating of this hotel will be affected by an accident that happened during our stay but you won't expect what you will read in any hotel, specially if 5 stars. Let's start by saying that i was there with a reward night, so the honey (moon) would taste even sweeter.. is a very nice hotel, french linen sort of speak, plus amenities of luxury level. If you don't get luxury in Paris, where else you should look? Booking, lobby, service.. all good cannot complain.. at all. Room small but nice, comfortable bed (a bit too high, i guess is the frech costume), bathroom clean, elegant and good lighting. And now let's face the problem: breakfast was included in the rate, what else best than freshly baked croissant, brie and cafe'? some fruit, cold cuts.. and more french cheese.. it was all there.. but was not alone.. to my horror in one of the niches, i can remember if was the cheese "station" or another, there were cockroaches.. now i am sure it was an accident, i sure it won't happen again, but people: whatch out! and this is a 5 star..

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: adrienne h
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location however the room and lobby is just average. About a 15 minute walk to Lourve. Breakfast is expensive and below average. Staff is professional and will go out of there way to accomodate you. I feel hotel is overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian hotel location - Ritz service, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DMLehman6
Reviews.Content: I booked the Castille based on other TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed! The hotel is on 'the back side' of the Ritz, next to a Chanel boutique. Walking distance to many major must-see and do spots, and easy Metro access. The room was generous enough in size to accommodate myself and 2 teens comfortably for 5 days. But what really set them apart was the all around 5 star service! Every member of the staff treated us like we owned the property. Kind, helpful, polite, friendly. The Concierege/s booked several meals for us - great suggestions. Helped us arrange transportation. We enjoyed breakfast in the onsite restaurant. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone except families traveling with small children. Can't wait to return with my spouse. It's very elegant - could be 'romantic'. Wireless worked well in the bar/main area - so could be good for business. Want to especially thank Marc Amathiuex, F&B Manager, for going out of his way to make my teens feel very Parisian and grown up (non-alcoholic 'cocktails' in the early evening).

Reviews.Title: “Snooty service albeit great location”
Reviews.Author: luxe4less
Reviews.Content: Dun let the chic entrance lobby and neat (very little) rooms disguise the fact that this fab locale hotel veers on the expensive for a small room. Bed n brekkie is close to 300euros per night and once u open yr suitcase u can barely walk around the room! Still it's fab locale is what makes this hotel so damn irritatingly convenient! Wish the rooms were larger and service just that bit nicer and really, throw in free Internet cos for 25 euros a day, it's daylight robbery!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLC1234
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly through work and have never had a bad experience. This hotel is in a convenient location within walking distance of the Jardin Tuilleries, the Louvre and the shopping district. Staff are always very friendly and helpful. Rooms vary in size but are well decorated and comfortable. Breakfast is good. Bar service also excellent. This isn't a large hotel but it does still have a small fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a fantastic location. Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: HMamiye
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms for our family and spent 4 nights at this hotel - each room was unique and pleasant - whether a superior room or a duplex suite - all were well appointed and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent , concierge extremely helpful and friendly (none of the attitude you sometimes get at a french hotel). Lobby bar was a nice place to relax after long days of touring / shopping. Location is perfect and convenient to most of what Paris has to offer. Would definitely be my first choice next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: Daunne
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at this hotel at the recommendation from other friends. We could not find a description about this hotel in our guidebooks and relied on the recommendation of our friends. We requested early check in which they could not accommodate, however, they kept our luggage safe and directed us to the guest shower located in their very small, but well stocked (water and apples) workout room. This was a welcome relief after a long flight. We asked to see the type of room we would be receiving (deluxe suite). It looked fine. When we returned later in the afternoon to check in, we were shown our room. It was smaller and older than the previous room we saw. The carpet was very dirty and the room was very cramped. We said that this wasn't acceptable and requested that we meet with the Duty Manager. This individual was great. He upgraded us to a suite (2 rooms) at no extra cost beginning the following day which was acceptable to us. Had we not been upgraded, our stay at this hotel would not have been nearly as nice. The front desk staff was very helpful, all spoke English and all of the Concierge staff were great, especially about restaurant recommendations. Our breakfast was included and we cannot compliment the restaurant staff enough! Everyone was attentive and willing to provide us with our special requests (extra coffee, cooked to order eggs, special bread). Because we were there for 10 days, our preferences were automatically served to us toward the end of our trip. Make sure that you check out your room in advance and be aware that the deluxe suite is very, very small. For one person or a couple, it's o.k. but for two singles traveling together, you need a bigger room. While expensive ($395.00 euros per nite), the location was outstanding. In one direction you can walk to the Seine, Tuillieres gardens and the Louvre. In another direction, to the Place de Madeline where all of the transit connections are made. I recommend "Flottes" a bistro 1 block away for dinner - we ate there several times and it was recommended by our Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MissTinaIrvine
Reviews.Content: After staying in our cramped room at the Westin, Paris last year, I was pleasantly surprised by the size of our room at the Castille. We had a sitting area downstairs and a king bed up the stairs. Upstairs had a full size bathroom, while the downstairs had a bathroom with a toilette and sink. This room perfectly accommodated our family of three. They transformed the sitting room couch to a bed for my daughter. The staff here was also very friendly and helpful. The area the hotel is situated in is also great. It is in walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame. The only problem we had, was the broken air conditioner. It was broken the three nights we were there. They did bring us a fan when I requested one. If I find myself in Paris, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smallbrownbike
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, with its excellent location, friendly staff and peaceful environment. You just cannot beat its situation for all the Paris sites, metro, ships and park. Being on a small side street as well ensures its not that loud outside either. Right next door to Chanel for the fashion historians and there are plenty of bakeries, cafes and restaurants nearby. The Coco room we had was a decent size and the hotel restaurant is well worth experiencing for the courtyard setting and excellent food. We’ll certainly return to this hotel next time we’re in Paris as it offered us everything we could require.

Reviews.Title: “Ne habozz!”
Reviews.Author: Basli
Reviews.Content: We spent our marriage anniversary in Paris with my lovely wife and finally I choose Castille which decision was a very good choice. This was her first time at this amazing city and it was a very crucial point of view to find a hotel which helps to her to get the "Paris feeling" as much as possible. The room wasn't too big but the interior was beautiful except the shiny marks on the black cabinet. There were separated bathroom and toilet and both were clean and well equipped. Our room was very quiet because it faced to the restaurant garden. I don't know how noisy can be those rooms which are faced to the street (Rue Cambon) which street seemed relatively noisy on weekdays by the horning cars. The all hotel is decorated with loads of antique style furnitures and paintings while you have a very special modern feeling instead of an oldish museum effect. The service was kind, excellent, prompt and very helpful. We liked the breakfast a lot but at the 3rd day it had became a bit boring to have the totally same supply. Taken together we enjoyed our trip a lot and if we went again to Paris then we would have chosen Castille again. Beautiful hotel, excellent location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location of the Castille is so good!”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchie
Reviews.Content: Last week we've stayed for the third time at the Castille. The first time our daughter was with us, the second time we stayed in a suite because our son ánd daughter joined us, and this time we were just together. This time our room was a bit small, the other times we really had great/big rooms. The room was nice though and the bathroom was fine too, lots of space to put all my belongings. Breakfast is okay too, we don't eat that much in the morning, so we're fine, but I can imagine that for others it might be a 'typical French breakfast' ;-) The second time we've stayed at the Castille the concierge made dinner-reservations for the four of us at 'Hotel Costes', and we had a great evening there. Hotel Costes is just around the corner in the rue Saint Honoré. We love that street! This time we made dinner-reservations at the Buddha Bar (rue Boissy d'Anglas) which is also quite nearby the hotel. Next to the Buddha Bar is this great shop, l"Eclaireur, where you really have to go if you like Fornasetti! We also went to a ballet at the Opera Garnier, and we enjoyed walking there, since it is only a 5 minute-walk. We've been to Paris quite a few times, but the past 3 times we liked staying at the 1st quartier, and that's one of the reasons we like the Castille!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fashion and close to major landmarks”
Reviews.Author: jhaOhio
Reviews.Content: Each neighborhood has a flavor and this one's is fashion--without the congestion of Champs-Elysee. If you don't want to look like a tourist, wear black. The lobby is unassuming and small, but we were upgraded to a spacious two-story room for the three of us. Very elegant and comfortable. Desk staff were helpful and the concierge outstanding. I would definitely consider going back to the Castille again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DASarasota
Reviews.Content: The Castille is a smallish hotel located in a nice neighborhood near the Tuilleres. I stayed there with my wife and 9 yo daughter. We were treated in a professional manner throughout our 5 day stay. Our room was very nice and clean. It might be considered small by some, but the three of us were quite comfortable. If you are looking for a disney or nickelodeon style hotel, look elsewhere. The staff really went out of their way to make our stay a great time. Whoever said the French were rude, must of had it coming to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: annaleiseandsiobhan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in the City of Lights. It's located in a great neighbourhood quite near to several shops, restaurants and just across the street from the Ritz! Rooms are not very large but nice and comfortable, beautifully decorated and the best are cozy. Baths too are not that large but still nice and clean. The breakfast room is lovely and they serve a really good breakfast. The Castille offers some of the best in customers service. We had no disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “The most elegant hotel in an elegant neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: rayoflightcanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April for 3 nights and it was amazing, very professional service, breakfast was the best, I booked the duples junior suites, Champagne & straberries on arraival, the hotel is centrally located & you can walk to all landmarks. the neighborhood is all trendy fashion boutiques and there are cafe'sand restaurants. the room can fit 3 people, 1 sofa bed, 2 storeys & 1 washroom marble with etro toiletries. the staff are very polite and helpfull when you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: tej020
Reviews.Content: Horrible, dark little room, furniture worn out, construction outside the window and been bitten by Bed Bugs! ...avoid Room 203!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious & friendly hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: TopsMA
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was wonderful & the staff pleasant, friendly & helpful. Our room was a little squashed with three of us in there but not uncomfortable. Housekeeping was thorough although I was disappointed that more attention wasn't paid to environmentally friendly procedures, such as the choice to have, or not have, fresh towels & sheets every day & every light was left on in the room all day after housekeeping had been there. The hotel was beautifully decorated with an adequate fitness room but with only 4 pieces of equipment. The bar & the service there was excellent ( we did have a trainee bar man one night, who didn't know how to make a G & T or what Tanquary was!) but pricey. The restaurant was unfortunately closed most of our stay which was a shame as the menu looked great! My only complaint would be the price of breakfast, 24 euros, for a buffet continental which was very nice but for that price I want more than croissants, bread & fruit, cheese etc & I want it served to me! Try local street cafes if you only want a croissant & coffee & if unprepared to be a Parisian there's a Starbucks just up the road! The business centre was a computer & a printer that usually had a teenager on Facebook! WiFi is only free for a limited short time. NB: excellent & very helpful concierge! The location was quiet over the weekend, with Chanel, Jimmy Choo & John Galiano to name but a few designer stores close by. The Ritz is around the block so possible celeb sightings! The Tuileries & the Louvre was a short walk away. Good restaurants all close by if you are prepared to walk a short distance. To sum up, a great hotel, a little pricey but fantastic service & location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: DublinKasey
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay in the Castille Hotel. There were 3 of us in a triple deluxe room and considering hotel rooms in Paris are notoriosly small I was very pleased with the room size. Also the bathroom was lovely with a separate toilet off the bathroom area which was very spacious indeed. The decor of the room (black and white coco style) was very pretty and being near the Chanel shop meant it was very in theme. The staff were very helpful and especially the Concierge who helped us with restaurants and other things. The location is second to none being easy to access all the main sights and the metro very close by. The area seemed very safe and great shops also. Overall I was very impressed with the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: FireflySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at first visit with colleague was shown my room and was offered two options for an upgrade. If this happens to you, do not turn down a chance to see the upgrades. We had booked a superior room which was a bit crowded for 2 people with our overseas luggage. Was shown one upgrade which included a two story loft and living quarters both upstairs and downstairs. We then saw a second room that was "smaller" with a similar two story arrangement. We took it! And enjoyed every bit of it. Hotel is elegant with old style oil paintings on walls and next door to the Chanel offices. Lovely 2 block walk to the gardens and the river and to shopping. Room service had difficulty with English that resulted in errors.

Reviews.Title: “Castille - love”
Reviews.Author: juliablyum
Reviews.Content: When i'm in Paris always staying at Castille! In my opinion it's the most cosy hotel and the best location! This year it's finally on my favorite booking site www.tablethotels.ru/com with the best rates, it is easier to get the best room with Tablet. My advices to everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay...”
Reviews.Author: ireland67dublin
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay in great location hotel. We had a lovely black and white deluxe bedroom but be mindful the room is close to the old elevator which causes some (albeit small) noise. We will try the deluxe beige rooms in the back of the hotel next time. Strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian chic”
Reviews.Author: RafeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Right on Rue Cambon, a hop and skip from Chanel's atelier and in the heart of St. Honore' shopping street in Paris. Great location! Rooms are well appointed and beds are comfy. Nice breakfast and very helpful concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot comfortable but tres expensive”
Reviews.Author: JeMi1906
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 night weekend as a couple. Good location, staff, cleanliness, comfortable rooms - just a bit expensive. Two glasses of champagne from the bar €38! Still we had a great time and would recommend this as a great base from which to explore Paris and retreat to when your feet are tired.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugg72
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights and truly enjoyed the location, outstanding service, friendly staff and overall charm of the Castille. Concierge took great care of us including many great dinning recos. Another perk was the amazing shopping surrounding including Chanel, Gucci, Dior, etc.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and very comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: felix11_10
Reviews.Content: that was my second time in Paris, and im so happy that i choose Castille hotel this time..The location was perfect, the rooms very comfortable and specious for the french standards.Breakfast was delicious..Ben at the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back soon..”
Reviews.Author: katrz123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights - Two adults and a 5 years old girl. We are so happy for having stayed here because the room (3 bed room - deluxe room) was so clean,fresh and the hotel staff was so serviceminded. We are very happy for this hotel and will stay at this hotel everytime we are in Paris. We will also recommend the cozy and romantic hotel restaurant - with high quality and delicious food. Quit expensive but you get value for your money. Very nice restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, bad value”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeachFamily
Reviews.Content: A well located small hotel with a reasonably elegant lobby and public spaces. My room (deluxe) on the second floor was small and dingy: filthy carpet, scuffed walls, mismatched furniture, curtains covered with dust and grime from the street. Bathroom (separate toilet) was clean but had loose tiles, scuffing on walls and old, washed out towels (and bathrobes). The bedding was clean, apart from the old bedspread. I had stayed in this hotel before and had an even more tired single room under the eaves, so this time I requested a deluxe double. The internet server was unavailable during my stay. The restaurant was closed on Saturday night and the bar service was slow and inept. The reception could not find my reservation and had to "check with the manager" to produce a room. The concierge was helpful. The hotel has a great location and some character - unfortunately, at least some of its rooms are substandard and terrible value.

Reviews.Title: “THE best kept secret of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gregorio72
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed, or rather, returned to the Castille for a business trip. The location is absolutely unbeatable, within walking distance of all my clients but also all the main attractions. Very handy when you only have a couple of hours during your stay to buy the mandatory gift to the wife and kinds :-) Rue du Faubourg St Honoré is 20 meters away, Place Vendome (for madame), 50, OPera, Madeleine. Paris revolves aournd the hotel. I also like the fact that for the price of a room in a "big 5 star", I get a Junior or even a Duplex Suite at the Castille. Besides, it has an appartment feel to it. Last but not least, as it is an improvement from last stay, they have redone the restaurant, very tastefully, but mostly gotten a new chef and the new cuisine is a must try. Rooms can always be bigger and service always better, hence teh 4 points... besides it keeps the hotel on their toes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Castille!”
Reviews.Author: footnotesetc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Castille Paris was a delight! The people, the service, the decor, it's rare in our frequent travels, but everything came together and we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed at Castille!!!”
Reviews.Author: rahaiza
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a painful and traumatic experience during our last stay at Hotel Castille last August. A thief entered our room, broke the zipper of our luggages which were locked and stole all of our precious belongings. Amazingly, the robbery happened in the middle of the afternoon and the concierge even saw the man leaving the hotel with the loot!!! My husband and I together with our 2 small children were staying in a suite at Hotel Castille for 5 nights in August 2010. Our room was at the old wing and there were only 4 rooms (including ours) on that floor. The robbery happened on our last day staying at the Hotel. As usual, before we left the room we made sure that our things save for the children's toys and some clothes were packed in our luggages and locked. We made sure that we took extra steps to be prudent as the Hotel had hired temporary cleaners given that it was the summer holidays. In addition, there was also on-going renovation at the Hotel. Hence, we thought that it was best for us to be cautious with our belongings. We were told that after we left the room, a man had approached the hotel cleaner and told her that his family was staying in Room 454 which was in fact our room!! He said that his children were allergic to the products in the room and he instructed the cleaner to open the windows and put fresh towels in our room. When we left the room that afternoon, the room was already cleaned and fresh towels were already placed in the bathroom. When I came back with my son to the room, the whole place was ransacked..the bags were opened and the things were all over the floor. The windows were wide opened and there were fresh towels placed on the bed which clearly indicated that the cleaner must have been in the room prior to the robbery. There were no signs of break-ins so what actually really happened ie whether the thief had immediately entered the room after the cleaner entered our room was not made clear to us. According to the hotel, the keycard to enter the room uses a code which is secure and protected and cannot be duplicated!! We waited for about 2 hours for the police to come and we were then told to go to the police station to make a police report. The hotel said that they will compensate us for our taxi fare but that didn't happened. We were stuck at the police station in a scary part of Paris for more than 4 hours and by the time we got back to the hotel it was close to midnight. Our 2 young children aged 6 and 2 were exhausted and of course traumatized by the whole incident. The next morning as we were checking out, my husband realized that he had left his shoe in room 454 (we had by then moved to a new room). I contacted the front office and requested if someone could send his shoe over. However, I was told by the guy at the front office that someone had checked in to the room last night and the cleaner did not find anything there. We later found out that the guys had blatantly lied to us and my husband went up to the room and found that the room was left in the same condition as we had left them. Notwithstanding, the poor experience we had stayed at the Hotel we were asked to pay for the 5 nights without any consideration for a discount or compensation from the Management. Since the incident happened, I have written to Starhotel's (owner) President, their customercare, GM of the Hotel and the Marketing Director. Other than the emails from the Marketing Director requesting for the name of the police officer and copy of the police report, there was no response from Castille or Starhotel. I find the kind of service or in this case the lack of it from a 4star Hotel like Castille utterly dissapointing!! Mrs Razman

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, luxurious hotel with friendly staff and wonderful food”
Reviews.Author: tina063
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, you wish to feel like you are in Paris and here, in the heart of the fashion district, next door to Chanel where Coco Chanel lived, this charming, small hotel makes a refreshing change from the host of chain hotels lacking character and real local warmth. The hotel exudes style, old fashioned class with a modern twist as the designer of the hotel is Italian - cosy but sumptious. Rooms are beautiful and the restaurant L'Assagio boasts fresh italian cuisine of the highest order. I thoroughly recommend this hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: luvzparis
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Paris on many occasions, I found this hotel to offer rooms larger than the norm at a great price in what was a perfect location for my needs. The street was very quiet and made for a great night's sleep. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: edwoodfr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated for visiting all the major attractions- our intended stay was only for 4 nights but due to the volcanic ash crisis we had to extend our stay. The staff were very accomodating and allowed us to remain at the hotel and kept our discounted room rate the same even though we had been upgraded to a suiite. The rooms were excellent the bonus of a second bathroom with a child is essential and even the staff who made up the child's bed in the evenings were amazing. We can't wait to revisit and will measure all others by our experience here. The only downside was not being able to find anything on the bar menu that my son liked hence we ate outside the hotel- however he did love the fact he could eat cake for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dcinns
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel, WONDERFULL staff who could not do enough for you. We were surprised to be upgraded to a suite when we arrived and LOVED it. The room was very comfy and it was great having the second bathroom. This hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance to many of Paris's attractions. I would not hesitate to reccoment\d this hotel and would definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Furryboots
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris and we were very happy with our hotel. Within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame and various other attractions of note, it is ideally situated. We chose to upgrade to a Junior Suite as the Deluxe room looked a little cramped for three of us and we were pleased with the extra space and the sizable bathroom. Only downside of the room was the distinct lack of storage space and we felt that this could have easily been overcome with a little imagination (even bedside cabinets with drawers would have helped). Special mention to Beniot the concierge, who was extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for him. One general tip, if you are planning a trip to Paris, imagine what you will spend and then take double of that. We found it very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, discrete and small hotel near the heart of everything.”
Reviews.Author: PassportInPurse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right behind the Ritz, yet is on a very quiet street (next to Chanel). I arrived early in the morning, but due to the fact that a guest had left even earlier, they quickly had a room ready for me while I had coffee. The room, although a deluxe with king, was disappointing in the Venetian decor, but looked out on the street so that was not so bad. The bed was fabulously comfortable; sleep was induced immediately each night! Sadly the bar and restaurant were under renovation while we were there, which was not disclosed when I made the reservation (always an annoying discovery). However, the staff made up for that in excellent service, friendliness and wonderful suggestions for our visit (my 17 yr. old daughter joined me later in the day). The concierge even found a place for her and her friends to safely go dancing one evening while I was out to dinner. The girls had a fabulous time. I will definitely return to this hotel soon (this is my 5th or 6th trip to Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Bigapple20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I hosted our 20th wedding anniversary party in Paris that included 24 guests. We reserved 11 rooms for 7 days at Hotel Castille and ALL had an outstanding experience! From the moment our group started arriving, the hotel did everything to accomodate early check ins and also upgraded all of our rooms. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and worked hard to make our stay a memorable one. From the doormen, to the front desk, to the Concierge, housekeeping, and the restaurant, all made our trip a huge success. In addition to the great hotel and service, the location is unmatched. Key sites are within walking distance or a short metro ride. I have traveled around the world and have had no greater satisfaction with a hotel than Hotel Castille. I would highly recommend Hotel Castille for business or pleasure and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good, nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: BelGal
Reviews.Content: Have not been to Paris in some time so was unpleasantly surprised to find out how expensive it was. We live in Notting Hill in London but found Paris way more expensive. Hotel was nice although small with no wifi in room and the room decor a tad too tangerine. Staff was friendly and the location central. Cannot say there was anything majorly negative except the price, for a small boutique hotel it was very expensive and I did expect it to be better quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie_Cook
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I've been to Paris a lot, and the hardest thing to find is a nice consistent hotel with a staff that understands what I'm saying. The location is good, especially if you want to be near shopping. But it's also pretty close to the Louvre and similar tourist attractions. The hotel staff was nice, helpful, and gave great advice. They were always there when we needed them, and always willing to help. Thank you, thank you, thank you for this wonderful hotel. The room service was a bit limited, but was available at all hours. The room was nice, fairly noise free (great soundproofing), and the bathroom had an actual bathtub! If you're new to Paris hotels, don't be surprised by the size of the room. It's a pretty good size by Paris standards, but by US standards, you might think it a bit small. I was very happy with the size. The bed was very comfortable! The hotel has a small business center (one computer and printer) with free wifi access. However if you want wifi in your room, you'll have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Stanleyrover
Reviews.Content: The location of the Castille could not be better for visiting all the traditional tourist highlights. The hotel's staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located on a narrow busy street although the traffic noise is not obtrusive. The rooms are small but clean. Food is expensive so if you are on a limited budget eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TJBelfiore
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated in the heart of the business district. The hotel foyer is beautiful and elegant yet the rooms are quite old with many marks on the walls. The carpet needed replacing, I had my one year son crawling around the room with his clothes getting dirty all the time. A cot was provided for my baby, which was not up to standard. He didn't end up sleeping in it he slept with us in our bed. The breakfast was nice with everything fresh especially the bread and it was also in a beautiful setting, but they do not have any highchairs for babies, so our little one had to stay in the pram during breakfast. We did not find the hotel concerige very helpful at all, but the reception staff were ok.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: ervetamy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great vacation in Paris celebrating our 20th anniversary. I chose this hotel based partly on great reviews from tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The location is perfect - we walked everywhere. Great restaurants were literally just around the corner or down the street. We had a deluxe room on the third floor facing the courtyard and it was very comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was huge by european standards: we put one of our suitcases in it! The service was fantastic. From the moment we walked in, Sam at the front desk made us feel very welcome. The concierge service has been mentioned in several previous reviews and was fabulous. The only negative thing to say has already been mentioned by others: The breakfast was not included and the price is steep, so we ate at little cafes closeby. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value...”
Reviews.Author: americantravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed at this hotel. I hesitated over whether to write this review because I really want to keep this hotel to myself. But that wouldn't be right. The Castille is a pleasure - reasonably priced, lovely rooms, and an absolutely unbeatable location. My teenage son and I stayed in a duplex suite that was perfect for a relaxing long weekend. The room looked out on the Rue Cambon and the decor was stunning - cream and black in a sort of Venetian style that really was a treat to stay in. Our suite had two bathrooms and both were very nice. The room price was extremely reasonable for a central location in Paris. The breakfast buffet is ok, but the staff is not focused on buffet "maintenance", so towards the end of the breakfast seating it looks as if locusts have been through the dining room. My son is 14 and requires constant feeding - I mention this because we ordered room service twice during our stay and both times it arrived within 15 minutes. The food was good and the portions generous. The staff are attentive and friendly. We speak French, but I heard them speaking English and Italian to other guests. The best thing about this hotel, and the real reason I stay there, is because it's right next door to the Chanel "mothership". You can go and have a little shopping and Chanel delivers right next door. I used to stay at the Ritz, which is just across the street, until I did the math and realized that I could buy an extra skirt or a pair of shoes with the money I saved by staying at the Castille. I must not be the only crazy lady doing funny "shopping math" because my salesgirl at Chanel said they deliver at the Castille all the time. If Chanel doesn't make your heart beat faster, you can still enjoy the Castille because it's so centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Parisfan_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. We had booked a junior suite duplex for my husband and I and a deluxe room for our two children (20 and 14). Upon our arrival we were told that the hotel as a courtesy were upgrading the children to a junior suite duplex as well! They were delighted and it was such a nice gesture which made a very good first impression. The rooms were nicely furnished and very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. The location just could not have been better - the Louvre and Notre Dame within easy walking distance. Also surrounded by the most fabulous shops. The staff were all very helpful - we really loved our stay there and would definitely use it next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location and comfy”
Reviews.Author: caroline077
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in superior room which was quite cumfy.. Hallway very smelly for some strange reason, but otherwise, wonderful staff, hotel situated close to shopping district, Louvre and many other brilliant attractions. thoroughly recommended.!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel - perfect for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: lavoguette
Reviews.Content: Just had a great short stay at this hotel. From the minute I arrived the service was impeccable. The hotel is very nicely decorated, the room a good size with plenty of wardrobe space and nice marble bathroom (with bath!) and separate toilet. Location is literally next-door to Chanel on Rue Cambon and perfectly located for shopping and for seeing many of the Parisian sights. Got a fabulous deal with a 3rd party travel company so it worked out at great value. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a wonderful hotel but who maybe can't stretch to 5star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mexbarza
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was very good, the staff was friendly and helpful. We got a superior room and the size was quite ok, considering usual European dimensions. The key for a very enjoyable stay for us was the location, everything is close by, you can get in and out using public transportation (RER, Metro, Bus, etc.) and a lot of the main Paris attractions are just a few blocks away. The concierge was particularly helpful, he got tickets for us and recommended some fancy places to try out.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: SunFlowerRose30
Reviews.Content: After seeing the pictures of the hotel rooms and reading the other reviews on TA, we chose Castille Hotel for our fourth Paris visit. We paid for a deluxe room and were really excited about our stay. When we arrived the check-in was smooth and the reception staff friendly. But seeing the room gave us a shock. The room looked NOTHING like the pictures on the website had indicated. It was soooooo small, and not very clean (the carpet was dirty and stained, same with the the bed throw). But the worse was really the toilet. It was separate from the bathroom, and no sink in the toilet. It was so small that it was tricky to get in and close the door. The bathroom with the sink, bathtub and shower over it, were ok but nothing more. After "complaining" about this we were told that this is indeed the deluxe room but they all had different "lay-outs". And that the hotel had given us this room because it was at the back of the hotel and should be quiet. Anyway, we were moved to another room (not before the next day though). The new room had no different "lay-out" as they had told us, it was the same. Just a tiny bit bigger (with a bigger bed). Still separate toliet, but at least we didn't have to struggle to get in this time. No complimentary WiFi, but there was ONE computer downstairs. But unfortunately not very easy to use, since there were people occupying it for 2 hours (the hotel reception gives a 2-hour access to the guests). Which is ridiculous if they only have one computer available. The neighbourhood is nice with all the designer shops around, and being quite in the center. But it's very quiet and not easy to find restaurants, cafes or bars around here. If we hadn't paid as much as we did, the hotel would have been ok. But it was definitively not value for the money, and not the standard we expected or are used to. So if you are spending around 300 euros per night for a hotel room, we don't recommend this hotel to be the best chice. You'll be disappointed 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable and gorgeous trip to the "City of Love"!”
Reviews.Author: asconetta
Reviews.Content: from the first step into the hotel castille our stay there was unforgettable. not only was the staff incredibly friendly and the room marvellous, but also the area was awesome. i know paris very well and am very well conscious of how difficult it is to find a real good hotel in the very centre. shop till u drop - you can start in the first house next to this hotel: the chanel boutique is giant and staff there very nice. louvre, galeries lafayettes, blvd st.germain, montmarte...-you can go everywhere on foot in only few mins! at castille you get everything you want, even at night. fantastic hotel, beautiful rooms, quiet though in the middle of the centre, next to opera, champs-elysees, eiffel tower, ... we got a free upgrade for a duplex suite - fabulous!! we'll certainly be coming back to castille!! many thanks for this amazing stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location, nice rooms, good breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I was seriously hesitating between this one and the Hotel de la Tremoille and finally decided to go by the Castille since the location was more convenient for me (the other one is in the Triangle d'Or, not bad but very bad company on the Champs Elysées...) The location is indeed great, just a few steps from the Hemingway Bar of the Ritz and next to Chanel. All the greatest maisons de couture are in the neighborhood. I had booked a Deluxe room, which was 25m² (270sq ft), on the fourth floor. This is not exactly a large room but it was very nice and comfy, especially the bed (good mattress). No noise at all during the day or the night, which allows you to recover well after a good day of shopping. The breakfast is delicious and the Orange juice is, thank god, fresh. The room service has a limited choice but still, the food is good and not too much overpriced (not cheap either). The service is lovely and very helpful. I had asked for a Gardenia flower that I needed for a party. The concierge tried the best flower shops, even the one that provides the George V hotel with flowers and could not get it since Gardenias are hard to find during this season but he offered me several other choices. This hotel is definitely great, probably one of my favourite four stars in the city with the Hilton Arc de Triomphe

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: arcobaleno1978
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 1 night for business but I will be coming back!! Very nice staff, confortable rooms, good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing honeymoon - great hotel,great location fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: smith19dec2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 21st Dec to the 26th dec 09 for our honeymoon and what can i say but this hotel is amazing from check in to check out the staff could not do enough, we were greeted and reception by Helen who gave us a tour of the hotel and then took us up to our room. We have been upgraded to a duplex suite and it was amazing. A brilliant start to the perfect honeymoon. Breakfast was great good selection and good service. On Xmas day we chose to have a champagne Breakfast in out room which was just perfect. The location of the hotel is great one direction shops shops and the other the Louvre and the Champs Elysees. Paris was brilliant at xmas. Lots to see and do. We spent a lovely xmas day visiting the Eiffel tower. Lots of great restaurants around the hotel and very good prices for great food. A great trip, amazing hotel would love to return very soon

Reviews.Title: “wholly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Oscar007Bradford
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Christmas period and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The (deluxe) room was excellent - done in the Venetian style (see photos). Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. Two minor gripes: the restaurant was closed over the festive period - not a disaster but not notified either; and the leisure facilities were limited and would benefit from a small pool ot go with the sauna. Service was very good and the Concierge excellent. A thoroughly pleasant break. No hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: torn80
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel castille in july, 2009 so this review is somewhat delayed. this was the best hotel we have stayed in while in europe. the staff went above and beyond. Benoit (i think) was our concierge and made reservations and recommendations for every evening. on bastille day, he actually had dinner at the same restaurant we did! the room was unbelievably comfortable, as were the bed and the bathroom. our windows looked out on the street and we were able to see the planes flying over on bastille day. i only wish we could have stayed longer. we will definitely be coming back to this hotel the next time we visit paris. thank you again, belatedly, but thanks just the same.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review before we left since the hotel had been so helpful. The hotel was almost as good as expected with perhaps one negative. The carpet in our room was worn and clearly had a HUGE spot of some kind that had barely been cleaned. Otherwise, the two rooms were great and the service was very very attentive. The location was incredible, near everything we wanted for either walking or the metro. Ate breakfast at a little bar/cafe down the street one way or another across the other street, and was very happy, never tried the hotel breakfast, but we used the bar a lot. Ate a couple of times at the bistro down the street and at another around the corner, fabulous. Paris is not cheap as far as food, but we had a large group with college kids several evenings and we sure did have fun. Only one night there was some construction down the street that woke me up, otherwise, very quiet street. All in all, I'd definitely recommend the hotel. Not inexpensive for sure, but the location can't be beat and the staff was wonderful. Would definitely go back again. And the beds were very very comfortable, the rooms fairly large for Europe. Only wish they'd not charge for internet in the rooms because that was very expensive and seems like you pay enough that should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Castille made our visit perfect!”
Reviews.Author: b028047
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my 6-year old daughter a few days before my husband arrived. The front desk offered a free upgrade to a suite so that the three of us "could be more comfortable." We got a 2-story loft type of suite which was perfect as it had two full bathrooms (great for when everyone wants to get ready at the same time in the morning). The 2-story windows overlooked the courtyard and into the Chanel atelier. The living room with day bed gave us somewhere to have some family down time, and ensured a separate bed for our daughter. Room was clean and quiet and nicely decorated. Beds were comfortable and temperature control worked great. Suffice it to say we were very pleased with our room. Staff was really wonderful. They humored us as we spoke French poorly had and we didn't encounter anyone on the property who didn't speak English. Concierge and front desk staff (over our 6-day stay)gave good recommendations and recognized/remembered us after day 1. It felt very friendly and comfortable here. Room service accommodated our off-hour requests without fuss. Turn down service left extra bon bons after my daughter mentioned how much she liked them (that made her day!). Really loved this hotel -- my daughter did not want to leave -- and would recommend to anyone. We plan to stay here again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HKTHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with the hotel, especially in comparison to previous experiences of hotels in Paris. I am prepared to recommend it to others as long as luxury is not sought. The staff was very friendly, everything went very smoothly and the location is excellent. The room was quite spacious (or at least not small) and very quiet (despite facing towards the street). Someone could perhaps think that the room was slightly worn, but we thought that the cleanness and the freshness outweighed that minor problem. The minibar/room service was somewhat expensive, but it was our own choice to use the services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with "ifs, ands or buts"”
Reviews.Author: kimberlynyc120
Reviews.Content: The Castille Paris was a nice hotel for my purposes, a solo traveler in need of a place that was central for some sightseeing, on a budget. But I did have a few issues. The staff was very nice and tried hard to be accommodating. I arrived and my room wasn't ready so I left, got some coffee, came back in about 2 hours and the room was ready. I requested a room on a high floor and got the 5th floor out of 6. The hallways were quite narrow and dingy. The room, a Superior, was very small. For me, it was fine, for more than 1 it would be a squeeze. That said, everything about the room was mostly positive. The bathrooms, though small, had a separate door to the toilet and the bathtub was narrow but deep and long and made for some luxurious and relaxing baths after walking all day. The bathrooms are marble from wall to floor so they were very cold. Also, on my last night, I noticed some small worm like bugs on the floor where the toilet was, the firs time I'd seen any sort of critters, fortunately i was leaving the next morning. The closets are large but are lit by a horribly blinding fluorescent light that flickered a bit. Also, the television had just one American channel, CNN, and that was the one channel that was out for a couple of days. Figures, I didnt watch TV much anyway, but it would've come in handy late night when I kept waking up at 3am due to jet lag. The maid service was great as was the internet service, which was free, but you had to get a code from the front desk every time you wanted to use it. I didn't go to the bar but I did get to eat at the restaurant. The food was quite good, the risotto that they recommend especially, but the scene is odd. It is very quiet atmosphere, lots of solo businessmen, and there were only 4 tables when i was there. They do give you a 10% off card when you check in though. Another odd issue I had was on my original tour of the hotel I was told by the front desk woman that my breakfast was included, which was a nice surprise, however, the next morning after getting the breakfast buffet, before my first bite I was served with a bill and told that my breakfast was NOT included. Surprise 28 euro breakfast! I did get a note from the front desk apologizing and offering to comp the breakfast though, which was nice. Overall I think this is a nice hotel but very small rooms and a few kinks to get out service wise.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms for the value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlu24
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were lovely, they were a lot smaller than I thought they would be. Having been to Paris twice before and staying at other hotels, I was quite surprised on the size of the room. Great location and nice workout room. Breakfast was decent and the staff overall friendly. Recommend this hotel to people that need a great location and not that interested on being in a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lenox01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over thanksgiving week. Wonderful experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. they were very responsive via email prior to our arrival. We had breakfast included which was nice. Don't pay extra for the breakfast...it was only ok. Not worth the 28 euros they will charge you if not part of your package. The location is great. You can easily walk to the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. Tons of high end shopping. The metro is close by so easy to get around. The concierge gave us great recommendations for restaurants. There are a ton of wonderful and not super expensive restaurants in the area. We went to L'Absinthe for thanksgiving. Small, cute and great food. If you are looking for inexpensive but amazing chocolate go to Jeff de Bruges. Yummy belgium chocolates. Located on Rue Vignon not far from the castille hotel. Tiny little place. Enjoy the Castille. We did. .

Reviews.Title: “Not for children”
Reviews.Author: LondonAjm
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel but sadly let down by its Maitre d' - probably the rudest ever encountered. When querying why two simple children's portions of pasta should cost 44 Euro he was discourteous in his response & demanded an apology for querying the price! Fortunately this incident happened on our last night and the experience up to this point had been great.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, owing to weak US dollar”
Reviews.Author: leisurist
Reviews.Content: Located between the Opera & the Louvre, the Castille is a friendly 4 star that has become pricey, owing to the weak dollar. Location, service, and staff are fine. The facility is simply not worth the US$450 per night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonbabies
Reviews.Content: It's on Rue Cambon, right beside the first Chanel boutique. Our location was perfect, it was a very comfortable walking distance to a lot of attractions, the jardin, louvre, place de concorde etc. Only downside is the old & tiny elevator. Stepping in you could see that it's aged which only adds to its charm. I can't say charming enough, from the lobby seats to the dining area. However the room is my favorite, with huge french windows & pink flowers right outside. It's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia45
Reviews.Content: Like all previous reviewers, we loved our stay at the Castille this past week. For a family group of 5 adults and a child we were offered the Presidential Suite, comprising 3 ensuite bedrooms and a spacious sitting-room. The decor throughout the hotel is elegant and tasteful. We enjoyed the generous buffet breakfast each morning, though the dining room can be busy at times and the coffee served is shockingly weak! Most of all, the hotel's staff is truly welcoming and caring about the well-being of their guests and this creates a lovely ambience at the hotel. All this, matched with exceptional rates at this particular period and a superb central location, makes the Castille a wonderful place to stay in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Castille exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: JoyTTW
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review for Hotel Castille before I even arrived due to the excellent service I received before arriving - it was worth noting at the time and from the moment we arrived, until the moment we left, the staff at the hotel could not have been more pleasant, professional and attentive. We arrived early and were greeted by Rose who made us feel instantly welcome. We were also warmly greeted by Ludivine/head of reservations and Mylene, who both assisted me so wonderfully when making my reservation. I also met Louise/guest services - also so nice and welcoming. It is clear that this team is committed to making their guests happy. They gave us a wonderful room (w/ early check in) with a very elegant decor and huge bathroom - even nicer than I expected. It had a view of their beautiful courtyard (enhanced with wonderful painted scenes) in an extremely quiet part of the hotel (we heard nothing the whole week). The overall decor of the hotel is very chic and conveys a warmth and charm that I found very appealing. I also want to mention Benoit, the concerierge 'extraordinaire' who was so friendly and helpful. He recommended a great restaurant - Vin Chai Moi - right around the corner offering excellent cuisine and wine. Location/shopping: the hotel is adjacent to Coco Chanel's apartment/House of Chanel, Rue St. Honore at the end of the block, 5 minute walk to Pl de la Concorde, 5 minute walk to Pl Vendome, Opera House, etc. I expect great service when traveling and dining, but I unfortunately do not always receive it. When I do, I feel it is important to let others know. Needless to say I will be staying at Hotel Castille on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jewelem30
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my college roommates to celebrate a "significant" birthday and the hotel did not let us down! Our suite had 2 full bathrooms (for only 3 in the room) and a view of the Eifel Tower. The front desk did a great job of recommending places to eat and were very nice. We got a great price too through Expedia!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: BKAOslo
Reviews.Content: We can highly recomment the Castille. The location is super and on a quiet street, yet very central. Only a few minutes walk from the Madeleine metro station (hence easy to get around Paris), the Opera, Place Vendôme, and 10 minutes from the Louvre. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, and the concierge was great, offering accurate and good advice on restaurants, activities, etc. We had booked a superior room but was offered an upgrade to a jr. suite duplex. Although the room was nice, I must admit I wouldn't say it would be worth paying full price for it. Missed a clothes rack or something to hang our outer jackets etc. that you don't want to put in the closet with the rest of the clean clothes, so it had to stay on the chair. Super breakfast, very efficient service, and we also enjoyed a very delicious and pleasant meal (dinner) in the hotel's Italian style restaurant. BK, Oslo

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: BrainiacMe
Reviews.Content: In addition to all the other reviews which mention the good location etc, I just want to add: the rooms are definitely not the largest or most modern; the room I stayed in seemed a little worn. However, in my experience this is pretty normal for central big-city hotels, and the Castille was better than most I've stayed in. We were 3 adults in one room, which was pretty crowded, but the separate WC/bathroom helped a lot. The buffet breakfast was OK, with a good selection of pastries. However, the scrambled eggs were not to my taste - try a small helping before you dig in is my advice. And by all means get a room price where the breakfast is included – as I remember, the price for the breakfast was EUR 16/person. What really sets this hotel apart from the rest is the excellent service; I have NEVER felt more welcome than I did at the Castille! The staff really takes good care of you, and using English was never a problem at all. The tip we gave them was well deserved, indeed! A final tip: while it is easy to have the hotel call a taxi for you, getting it yourself is much quicker and about EUR6 cheaper. About five taxis pass the hotel every minute, and the narrow street makes it easier to stop one. Enjoy your stay at the Castille. We certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkerv
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel in early September and enjoyed everything about it. The hotel is close to shopping, the metro, sightseeing but is on a quiet street, so the traffic noise is minimal. The room was quite attractive and comfortable. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. I have no complaints about this hotel and would recommend it to others without hesitation. We ate dinner at a restuarant called La Cordonniere, also hightly recommended by Tripadvisor, which was only several blocks from the hotel -- easy walking distance. The food and service were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service from the reception desk and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PepiWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the location and the service at this hotel far exceeded a lot of the hotels I have stayed in. I encountered a couple of problems but to my surprise it got handled in the most professional manner. The staff at this hotel especially the reception desk were amazing. I would not hesitate to stay there again when I return and will tell anyone travelling to Paris to book this hotel. The gentleman that parks the cars was also amazing and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for the service.”
Reviews.Author: jdgwave
Reviews.Content: We paid GBP630 for 3 nights in a 'superior' room, but it was very small. The bathtub was very narrow and the shower head was half broken. The shower was not hot one day. Make sure you don't go to the breakfast which costs over 20 euros. On the whole, we just overpaid for the good location and despite some good service from staff, we had to go looking for our bags on the first night since they hadn't been brought to our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellls
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris with 2 young toddlers and we were unable to find a hotel that would accomodate all of us in 1 room. The Castille Paris was the only hotel that had what they called a triple room that would take a family of 4. We weren't sure what to expect but we were very happy when we checked in. We arrived in paris 6am and our room obviously wasn't ready. However, Eddie at the front desk was so helpful and accomodating. He was willing to upgrade us to a duplex room that was available immediately, however we decided to wait because we didn't want a two story room with stairs with 2 young toddlers. however, he still upgraded us to a suite and called us on our cell at noon when the room was ready.
