Our room was on the second floor overlooking the "courtyard". there really wasn't any to see except the next building 50 feet away. however the room was wonderful. we had 2 large rooms with high ceilings, modern decor and very clean. the king size bed was very comfortable and the room had a safe, blow dryer, a fridge and 2 large tvs. The huge floor to ceiling windows lined one entire side of the rooms and they had great blackout curtains. they had an extra bed set up for my 3 year old and a large pack and play bed for my 18 month old. the hotel also has a gym. not much by american standards but enough to get a workout. they had a tredmill, an eliptical machine a couple of benches and a basic set of dumbells. The hotel was in a great location. you are set in the middle of the fashion district with a lot of high end stores around. Channel was next to us. you are only a few blocks from the tuileries gardens and the metro and a 5 minute walk to the Louvre. There are a few restaurants in the area but they were very expensive. we asked the hotel for a casual, easy place to pick up a quick lunch and they recommended a small restaurant s couple blocks from the hotel. we ordered 3 bowls of plain pasta, a soda and a bottle of water and it was $70 US dollars! Very expensive all over paris. A can of soda was around 6 dollars in many places - so be aware before you buy! The tuileries garderns has a permanent carnival set up that the kids enjoyed at night. the only difficulty we had in the area was that there was no supermarket or small store to buy some milk, fruit and basic things for the kids. the closest one requirred us to take the metro. However we found a great market near the eiffel tower that was resonably priced and we stocked up and had what we needed for the rest of the trip. Overall GREAT hotel in a GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared for Bad Service!”
Reviews.Author: JeanieKAS
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the glowing recommendations from other TripAdvisor reviews. Unfortunately, the hotel didn't live up to any of our expectations. All of our problems centered around the horrible service. It's a shame because the room was actually quite nice. The staff is friendly, but totally inept and not empowered AT ALL to solve any of the problems encountered. The trouble started when we attempted to use our phone to call the concierge for dinner recommendations our first night (a must if you don't know Paris very well). None of the service buttons on our phone worked (operator, front desk, concierge, housekeeping, room service, etc.). So, we had to walk down to the lobby after we finished dressing. What a surprise to find out that there was no concierge... at 8pm on a Friday night! We reported the phone trouble to the bellman and he wrote a note to the lone desk receptionist (too busy with another guest to answer our questions about the phone). The next day, we were missing a robe. We tried to use the phone to call housekeeping, but it still wasn't working. No one ever called us back or contacted us about the phone. Good thing we didn't have any true emergencies that would require a working phone. And, there still was no concierge to help us with a dinner selection on the second night... at 7pm on a Saturday night! The front desk attendant seemed confused by the phone and concierge complaints, but didn't really have any solutions. She then told us someone would contact us before we checked out the next morning at 9am. Guess what... no one ever called us back. We had to complain to the front desk attendant (again) as we checked out. At that point, we were "promised" the desk manager would reach out to us when he arrived later that morning. As expected, we never heard from him either. This is on top of the worst hotel bar service I've ever experienced (no one in the bar, 15 minute wait to track down a bartender, flat champagne and prices higher than the Hotel Costes!). So, if you decide to book this hotel, please ask the desk receptionist for their special phone dialing instructions when you check in (these are not furnished in all of the rooms), ask when the concierge will be available, and avoid the bar AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss -- and I missed big time this visit”
Reviews.Author: Chargingruby
Reviews.Content: My second stay here, after one back in March 2009. I paid about $800/night then for a suite, and it was sophisticated, clean and sleek. I was very happy. I just checked in again, this time booking a single room with two beds, for $500/night, and I was served up a very small room that's a dump. Carpet is filthy, walls are scuffed up and it's a pigsty. Wouldn't mind a small room if it was well appointed, but this is small and trashy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lou029
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Paris and stayed in the Hotel Castille. I went for the weekend with 2 girlfriends and we stumbled across the hotel whilst booking our Eurostar tickets What a find. The location is second to none. The back door of the Ritz is a couple of doors along and once outside the hotel you are seconds away from fantastic shopping and great restuants. The hotel itself is funky, bijou, very clean with very helpful concierge - ask for Sam!! We got upgraded as it was my birthday to a lovely, modern, clean room with all mod cons. you can walk from almost anywhere and there is a lovely little courtyard at the back where you can have tea and cake I cant wait for my next trip to Paris as I will definatley be returning to the Hotel Castille. Value for money is superb

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Makes me Want to Return to Paris”
Reviews.Author: spettypi
Reviews.Content: I had such a wonderful stay here. From the great breakfast in the morning (and i mean great, lots of meat, cheese, traditional american breakfast food and pastries to choose from), the very helpful and knowledgeable staff, comfortable beds, and the cute, clean rooms - this place couldn't have been better. We were here on our honeymoon for five nights. They also have free wi fi and a computer in the lobby and a nice fiteness center (not one of those that is like a dundgen in some hotels) The hotel is neighbored by high-end shops like Chanel, Dior, and Jimmy Choo. The restaurant selection around here was expensive, but it is an easy walk to other parts of the city. It is also across the street from the famous Ritz bar. This hotel actually made my experience in Paris better and I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the castille. This was our 6th trip to Paris but our first stay at the Castille. For us the hotel is in a very convenient location. We booked a superior room and it was very spacious and comfortable. Our room overlooked the internal area of the hotel is it was lovely and quiet. We slept very well. The hotel staff we very friendly and helpful. My only slight complaint is the lack of parking outside the hotel, there is none. We were being picked up for our flight back to NZ and as our driver could not park outside the hotel to come in to see if we were ready (which we were) and as it is only a single lane down Rue Cambon and the traffic gets backed up it caused him to be 30 minutes late to collect us. It would be great if there was a small area that cars could pull off the road. Other than that our stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation in the center”
Reviews.Author: s_ljubicic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the great location, near metro and you can visit almoust every famous location by foot (Louvre, Orsay, Place Vendom, Place de la concorde). All other famous locations are 10 minutes by taxi. Hotel staff are young friendly peole most willing to help. Rooms are rather small but very clean. Rue Cambon is very silent streer. Only remark is that my room was having bad smell, from smoking in the past, I assume. Sandra

Reviews.Title: “great location but small room”
Reviews.Author: naolondon
Reviews.Content: The location was very good for shopping , visiting everywhere and restaurant. The reception, breakfast and room everything were very sofisticated very much. But the room was very small and also was bed for this price. I just stayed there only one night. If you choose it just for the location , it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Scanlord
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to many countries in Europe and have stayed at some excellent hotels, but none came close to the quality of service afforded by the staff at the Castille Hotel. From the day of our arrival until we left every request we made was met with a smile, an "of course, monsieur or madam" and a quick resolution. Nahim, the concierge is incredible - he somehow got us a reservation at the Jules Vern. Overall, the staff is fabulous. The room was nicer than we expected and large enough so that we had room for four large suitcases. Breakfast, which was included, was a great buffet with plenty of choices including lunchmeat, salmon, eggs, sausage, fruit, etc. and the best orange juice I have ever tasted. The location is perfect. We walked to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, The Champs-Elysee. Actually, we walked just about everywhere. The shopping is all right there. The only negative is the slowness (very low signal) of the internet wireless connection. But, even though slow, all of our email and othet internet tasks got done. The Castille is a great little hotel and will be our home away from home whenever we go to Paris from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Easter 2009 Stay-3 rooms-Extended Family of 7”
Reviews.Author: MarkPGHPittsburghUSA
Reviews.Content: Our group consisted of 2 Seniors in their 70's, 3 adults, and two teens. We stayed on the 3rd floor facing the front of the Hotel . rooms 315, 308, 306. 315 was the smallest of the three rooms had a queen bed, in a smaller sleeping area, with a higher ceiling and a large bathroom. 306 and 308 were larger room with King beds and we had an extra bed in in 308 so we could fit the two teens and one adult in that room. The two king rooms had large bathroom with private toilet room also. More closet space in the King rooms vs the Queen room. Only downside of the King rooms was that they didn't have a chair to sit in. We requested a chair for the one King room and they brought up a plastic chair to place by the window.. Overall the service was great, our luggage was late arriving from our flight so the staff at the hotel tracked the luggage for us and it arrived the first night after checking in that morning. The rooms including the bathrooms were very clean. The lobby is small with a few chairs and sofas. If you are looking for a hotel with large common areas to sit and talk or a large bar scene this hotel is not for you. Our rooms included breakfast which was a buffet mostly continental fare with a few hot items, eggs, bacon, and sausage. Fresh juice, and coffe was served. It was very good. We did not dine at the hotel beyond breakfast. We did enjoy the small courtyard outside the dining room for a late afternoon snack once. The location is close to the Metro left out of the hotel and a 5 minute walk to Madeline Metro Stop. Right out of hotel and about 8 minute walk to Concorde stop. We walked a lot real close to to high-end shopping Chanel, Hermes, etc. Louvre about 15 minute walk or so. Opera about 10 minute walk. The front desk will call you a cab if you need one. One way; one lane street in front of the hotel is nice because there is not much traffic and noise but loading and unloading in front of the hotel backs up traffic on that street. Looked in the Fitiness room but did not work out. walked so much in Paris we didn't need too. The room had treadmills, dumbells, separate bath and shower, plus sauna and TV. Did not use the wireless for my laptop only the kiosk pc and printer in the lobby which worked fine for internet and printing out travel voucher and boarding passes, and reading webmail. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Castille and in Paris. Staff was terrific. Only small complaint would be the aformentioned king rooms not having a side chair to sit in.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3 times and am going back.”
Reviews.Author: scowler
Reviews.Content: Reception could not fall over backwards enough to help you. I loved the room. The location is perfect. Smack bang in the middle of everything, so nothing is too far away. This is my third visit there and I love it. It's homely and they are lovely. I hate having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Proper 4* hotel in a heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: iolanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Castille for 4 days (26-30 March 2009). The hotel is locted perfectly, just 200 meters away from Rue de Rivoli & the Louvre. Though we changed the first room given as was dark & a bathroom wall was rusty, the other room (209, see the pic) was bright, clean & fair size. The staff was extremely helpfull & friendly. Breakfast was also fine as was included in the room rate (otherwise really not worth paying 28 euros per person as for example Laduree is just around the corner & costs less) and served in a lovely courtyard when weather is appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VasyaStamford_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Castille during our last visit to France. It has a great location in the City Center, right across from the Ritz. We traveled with our daughter and the hotel upgraded us to a two-level unit, which was a very nice extra. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but you can't expect more for the price and quality overall. The staff was outstanding, very attentive and willing to help with any arrangements we requested. The restaurant is expensive, the food was fine but I would prefer to eat Italian in Italy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located very centrally for tourists. Within walking distance to the Louvre, Opera House, etc. Room was a little dated(scratches on the walls, etc), but very clean. The staff was all bilingual(French/English). Room was large by Paris standards. The staff suggested a small restaurant called Lucerne, which is just around the corner. Very small, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraveler07
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Paris and stayed at the Castille. I had reveiwed all I could about the hotels in Paris on Tripadvisor and this one had the least problematic results so I chose it! NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! First off, very professional staff. Helpful, friendly and all were bilingual/fluent in English. Very nice room. Large for European standards. Large bathroom as well. Shower was a little narrow, however easy to overlook that! The room itself faced onto a street that has Chanel boutique, an elementary school,a financial instution of some sort and then further down a cafe and assorted little clothing stores. Hotel was quiet for the most part. You always hear people coming and going anywhere (ie doors). This is a high rent district, but close to all the major attractions/either by walking or Metro. Metro is effecient and quite easy to use + cheap!! Good bakeries are within walking distance filled with goodies...little grocery stores around Paris - Wine is dirt cheap there and good - buy a small brie, a baguette, some deli meat and of course the wine...save $$$ on lunch that way. I don't think there are any liquor laws about drinking in the park with a picnic?? Always order expresso or cafe noir or you get crappy coffee which isn't what you're looking for!!! Tips of 15% are included in the bill automatically - but most staff are quite friendly and polite and a tip of 1-2 Euro for the extra friendly ones goes a long way! If you stay at this hotel, there is a restaurant which has a little tea room and bakery attached that is just up the street and is called the Olympia Cafe I believe....excellent service, great atmosphere and all the dishes we sampled were all great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Castille”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchie
Reviews.Content: Last week I've stayed 3 nights at the Castille with my husband and daughter (She's 12 years old). Normally when we travel to Paris we stay at a nice little boutique hotel (Hotel de la TourMaubourg) in the 7th arrondissement. Since this hotel was fully booked I chose the Castille, because I thought it would be nice to explore the 1st arrondissement this time. And so we did. We had a nice time at the Castille. The neighbourhood is really pleasant, with all the great shops and Chanel next door! Lots of 'brasseries' for a breakfast, espresso or wine close by, and rue St Honoree is super to have so near to your hotel! I like the way the Castille is decorated. We had a 'triple-room': our daughter had her own bathroom and a pull-out sofa. With the stairs she came in our part, with our own bathroom. (marble as well). There was a large window to look at the rue Cambon which was really nice. The concierges were very kind and polite. In the evening we had some drinks at the bar and the barman was very sympathetic too. I find that in the past 10 years the French really have changed! (Much less arrogant! ;-) I must say that we would recommend the Castille and that we will come back whenever we'll visit the 1st arrondissement again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Castille!”
Reviews.Author: cingo2000
Reviews.Content: The description of the hotel sounded perfect. But when i went to read the reviews, several people complained that the concierge services were lacking, so we went ahead with the reservation but with apprehension. The service we got from concierges Benoit and Nahim was absolutely fantastic. While the room was lovely (after we changed three times), our concierges made the stay! If you are looking for a cozy little bar for a drink after dinner, though, please skip the bar in the hotel. The bartender was clueless. And defensive about his lack of knowledge! There are several other nearby places to go. We would defintely go back to the Castille.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful! Clean!”
Reviews.Author: sjpmom
Reviews.Content: For a quick weekend trip to Paris, and for our first time, this hotel was perfect! Our room was so clean and tidy! The bathroom nicely appointed-wc in another room was an added bonus, and a great hairdryer. It was not a big room, but I was not entertaining, It was clean and bright! The breakfast, included (check with the desk), was wonderful! But who wants to skip a meal in Paris, so I used restraint! The conceierge was fine. I didn't need too much. We were in a great neighborhood, and I was able to walk around without worries of being alone. Chanel, Leger, Cartier, Hermes...all right around you. Also, Zara, a GAP (of all things) and other resonable stores, although it is a city, and the dollar is BAD so eat, don't shop! Great selection of Brasseries (with great 16 euro meals) right around the corner. Not for young kids. A wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ania55
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel in a great location. The room was very clean and the maid service was great. We didn't have breakfast because 28 euros is a bit too much. Consierge was only ok - didn't seem to care too much when I asked him about places to go to in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: realtime-cheto
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week and the hotel is perfect - the location, the rooms and the maid service are excellent. We stayed in Superior King Size Room and it was very spacios, with separate living area and very nice interior. The only problem we had was the last night. Our son arrived for the last night of our stay and I asked, twice during the day, the sofa to be made up for the night. Unfortunately when we came back (around 23.00) nothing has been done. The maid wasn't there anymore, so we had to fix up the sofa. The receptionist apologised sincerely for the caused inconvenience, but our last night was spoiled. So, overall it is a very nice place, just make sure the staff writes down your request.

Reviews.Title: “Updated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fizzwick
Reviews.Content: Hotel redone in black/white design. Rooms are charming. Maid service was excellent. Breakfast was delicious. Hotel is across street from back of Ritz and entrance to famous Hemingway Bar, and right behind Place de la Concorde. Service from concierge and front desk was good but not great--they seemed to care but didn't quite care--maybe the manager was away or more training of staff was needed. This was not enough to ruin hotel stay but put a slight damper on hotel, the only flaw. Newly designed, the lobby and restaurant rooms are modern and colorful and beautiful. If the hotel staff got trained a little bit more in what clients need for comfort and vacation, the Hotel Castille would be absolutely perfect! The location is right in the middle of the best arronsidement, Madeleine is down the street, original Chanel store is next door, the best shopping is RIGHT there, close to Louvre and Rue de Rivoli. Fantastic shops and little restaurants--just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent excellent.....”
Reviews.Author: zaufald
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Castille Paris for a 4 night break to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday. The location is excellent, just off Rue Rivoli which has an abundance of cafes to choose from, and right next to Chanel, giving it a slightly more exclusive feel. It took us about 30 mins to walk to Notre Dame and it's a 5 minute walk into the gardens which lead up to the Louvre. At the other end of Rue Cambon you have a major shopping area and are right near a top wine seller - Lavinia. First impressions of the hotel were excellent - we were given a brief tour of the hotel's facilities by a very friendly receptionist and then shown to our room. You get what you pay for in Paris and whilst the room was not huge, it was a perfectly good size and had a generous bathroom. We had room 153 which looked out onto a garden and was very private. Everything was extremely clean and the bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever experienced away from home.... Service throughout our stay was excellent, a very well informed concierge, attentive bar staff and a well organised reception desk. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it looked very good. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkapricot
Reviews.Content: Castille's a lovely hotel in a very central location in Paris. The hotel is surrounded by many (designer) shops and is within walking distance of many attractions such as the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysees etc. The Gare du Nord station is only about 10-15mins away by taxi. The room although quite small was well furnished and cosy. The toilet, which was quite small as well, is separate from the bathroom. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. No problems at all! Nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: PoshWife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Castille last week. The service and location were good, but the rooms and hallways were in need of renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: jan59Essex
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a surprise trip for my birthday, 3 nights from 25th Feb, and having just read through some of the most recent reviews I can only agree that the hotel is excellently positioned for the Louvre & for travelling around Paris in general. We found the staff very friendly & the Concierge was most helpful in advising us about an open-top busride (As it was pouring with rain, he sent us to the office where the buses started from, meaning that we could grab 2 seats downstairs). We had a deluxe room & it was perfectly adequate - we could even see Napoleon on his column situated in Place Vendome from our window!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: TripAnorak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Starhotel Castille last weekend and we were not disappointed. It is perfectly situated in the Louvre area and ideal to get round Paris (Madeleine métro is nearby) and for shopping (the boutiques of rue Sainte-Honoré are seconds away, and Chanel is literally next door). Our room was comfortable (we were upgraded to the split-level 'duplex' suite) and very quiet. Staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast was first class, although expensive (it was included in our tariff, so we were relaxed). We did not try the restaurant for an evening meal, but the Italian restaurant in the next street rue Duphot (Le delizie di uggiano) was excellent, if pricey. Some minor drawbacks: our room was indeed very hot (as other reviewers have noted), the headline room prices are exorbitant (our suite was listed at over €1000 per night, which it was certainly not worth - as a result of booking online and the upgrade, we paid a third of that) and our room was slightly shabby and claustrophobic (in the duplex the space is all vertical rather than horizontal). Also, we had some water from the mini-bar that was obviously tap water in a bottle (it was sealed with a sticker, and with traces of previous stickers). We assumed we would not have to pay, but were surprised to see €9 on our bill. This was a rip-off, but to their credit the hotel did deduct the item when we protested. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hela1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castille for 3 nights and had an excellent experience. Our "superior room" was beautiful and spacious and the bathroom was large and clean. Our room was on the 4th floor, with a nice balcony, overlooking the Parisian roofs. The location of this hotel was excellent, we could walk everywhere, and the nearest metro was also walking distance. The hotel serves wonderful breakfast with a wide selection of cooked breakfast food, as well as pastries, cakes and fresh fruit. The staff was helfpul and very welcoming. We had a great stay and when we are in Paris next time, we will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great area, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aufcno1
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris in April 2007. This hotel is in a luxurious location near all the trendy boutiques and right in the heart of Paris. The hotel is very well decorated and feels special. The staff were all helpful. Rooms not the biggest but nice enough. Very expensive for dinner in the hotel and would go elsewhere if you are on a budget. We had a fantastic time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Treasure in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PhotoNYC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris was there from the 7th-14th of January and stayed at hotel Castille. The hotel was amazing, perfect location!!!!! Walking distance to every where you would want to go (except eiffel Tower). The staff was amazing kind gracious and went above and beyond to make sure my stay was the very best it could possibly be. The hotel it self was amazing. The decor was modern but very warm with a little bit of an old parisian flare. I stayed in room 506 which was the deluxe room and it was not small but not large it was a perfect size for 2 people with windows facing directly over rue cambon with it's own private balcony (not really much of a view). The bed was like sleeping on a cloud amazing very high thread sheet count. The food of the hotel was good did not eat at the restaurant but I did look really lovely, however I did order room service for breakfast on a couple of occassions and everything I had was great. I normally stay at the Ritz Carlton but could not get a room thank god for me because this is my new favorite hotel in Paris. It is a small boutique hotel with out the attitude that comes with most botique hotels. It is a must for anyone coming to Paris will make your stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lilmunkey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our first trip to Paris. - Room was nice- the bed was very comfortable. In fact we stayed in four other hotels thru Europe and the Castille bed was the softest/ fluffiest/ nicest bed we came across.The Bulgari bath products were nice- however bring your own conditioner if you are used to it. :) Hotel is in a great location- surrounded by fancy stores and lots of restaurants/ cafes. We never ate at the hotel restaurant but we glanced at the menu and it looked good. - There were just too many other places to visit! (Royal Madeleine being our favorite- 11, rue du Chevalier Saint-George// around the corner from the hotel) I really liked that the hotel left the weather forecast for us each night- it made it easy to figure out how to dress for the day. The staff was very nice anytime we came into contact with them- I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Castille Paris...Tres Bien!!”
Reviews.Author: turntime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Castille in April and it was fantastic! Although the room was small, it was very comfortable. The hotel is beautifully decoratedand has a nice restaurant. The best part of our stay was the service. The concierge was truly wonderful...he was able to get us reservations at the most famous restaurant in Paris...Taillevent (we highly recommend the chef's tasting menu)! We also went to the Buddha Bar, Paris' trendy bar/restaurant, which was also a magnificent experience. Another amazing characteristic of this hotel is the location...it is wihin walking distance to EVERYTHING...the Louvre, the opera, fhigh fashion/shopping, Champs Elysees. We definitely recommend The Castille!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic new Year”
Reviews.Author: sallyglebe
Reviews.Content: Booked because of the reveiws and we were not disappointed. Very helpful and friendly reception staff who gave us a quick conducted tour before showing us to our room. Furnishing are very French and the the bed was very comfortable. We had superior room which was relatively small but perfectly formed! We managed to book a table at the restaurant and had a wonderful meal - well banquet actually - on New Year's Eve. Breakfast was also very good. Wished we could have stayed longer as location just off the Place de la Concorde was very central.

Reviews.Title: “Service unsurpassed!”
Reviews.Author: SpikeColorado
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent an incredible week (Nov '07) at the Castille which is located right in the heart of romantic Paris. We wanted a special hotel: location, size and atmosphere. We were not dissapointed. The staff waited on our every need with attentive maid service and outstanding concierge attention. They made many arrangements and recommendations. On our last evening we were at the Louvre late sipping the last drop out of our week and I lost my wallet. We were leaving early the next morning back to the states and I thought sure I would never see my wallet again. Nahim, the head concierge, was able to track it down, went to the Louvre personally to retreave it and FedExed it back to the states! He blew the sterotype of the snobby Parisian out of the water. I highly recommend the Castille!
